State Coastal Policy Validation Act 2003

An Act to validate the State Coastal Policy 1996 and actions taken under or in pursuance of that Policy
[Royal Assent 16 April 2003]

Be it enacted by His Excellency the Governor of Tasmania, by and with the advice and consent of the Legislative Council and House of Assembly, in Parliament assembled, as follows:

1. Short title
    This Act may be cited as the State Coastal Policy Validation Act 2003 .

2. Commencement
    This Act commences on the day on which this Act receives the Royal Assent.

3. Interpretation
    In this Act –
        State Coastal Policy 1996 means the policy of that name prepared and made under Part 2 of the State Policies and Projects Act 1993 and notified in the Gazette on 7 February 1996.

4. Validation of State Coastal Policy 1996
        (1) The State Coastal Policy 1996 is and is to be taken as always having been valid.
        (2) Any act or thing done or omitted or required to be done or omitted in pursuance of, in reliance on or arising from the State Coastal Policy 1996 before the commencement of this Act is taken to have been validly done or omitted or required to have been done or omitted.

5. References in State Coastal Policy 1996 to coastal zone
        (1) A reference in the State Coastal Policy 1996 to the coastal zone is to be taken as a reference to State waters and to all land to a distance of one kilometre inland from the high-water mark.
        (2) For the purposes of subsection (1) –
            State waters has the same meaning as in the Living Marine Resources Management Act 1995 .

6. Administration of Act
    Until provision is made in relation to this Act by order under section 4 of the Administrative Arrangements Act 1990 –
            (a) the administration of this Act is assigned to the Premier; and
            (b) the department responsible to the Premier in relation to the administration of this Act is the Department of Premier and Cabinet.
